bis-11_motor_impuls.Description: Barratt Impulsiveness Scale 11 Motor Impulsivity (Second Order Factor). http://www.impulsivity.org/measurement/bis11

bis-11_nonplan_impuls.Description: Barratt Impulsiveness Scale 11 Non-planning Impulsivity (Second Order Factor). http://www.impulsivity.org/measurement/bis11

bis-11_attention.Description: Barratt Impulsiveness Scale 11 Attention (First Order Factor). http://www.impulsivity.org/measurement/bis11

bis-11_motor.Description: Barratt Impulsiveness Scale 11 Motor (First Order Factor). http://www.impulsivity.org/measurement/bis11

bis-11_cog_complex.Description: Barratt Impulsiveness Scale 11 Cognitive Complexity (First Order Factor). http://www.impulsivity.org/measurement/bis11

bis-11_cog_instability.Description: Barratt Impulsiveness Scale 11 Cognitive Instability (First Order Factor). http://www.impulsivity.org/measurement/bis11

neo-n_vuln-to-stress.Description: NEO Personality Inventory (Neuroticism) Vulnerability to Stress Facet.

kirby-short-prop-LL.Description: Kirby Delay-Discounting Questionnaire - (Short Delay) - Proportion of Larger Later Options Chosen.

kirby-long-prop-LL.Description: Kirby Delay-Discounting Questionnaire - (Long Delay) - Proportion of Larger Later Options Chosen.

upps_negative-urgency.Description: UPPS-P (59-Item) Impulsive Behavior Scale - Negative Urgency. http://www.impulsivity.org/measurement/UPPS_P

upps_lack-premed.Description: UPPS-P (59-Item) Impulsive Behavior Scale - Lack of Premeditation. http://www.impulsivity.org/measurement/UPPS_P

upps_lack-pers.Description: UPPS-P (59-Item) Impulsive Behavior Scale - Lack of Perseverance. http://www.impulsivity.org/measurement/UPPS_P

upps_sens-seek.Description: UPPS-P (59-Item) Impulsive Behavior Scale - Sensation Seeking. http://www.impulsivity.org/measurement/UPPS_P

upps_positive-urgency.Description: UPPS-P (59-Item) Impulsive Behavior Scale - Positive Urgency. http://www.impulsivity.org/measurement/UPPS_P

bisbas_bas-drive.Description: BIS/BAS (24-Item) Behavioral Activation/Inhibition (BIS/BAS) scales - BAS Drive. http://www.midss.org/content/behavioral-avoidanceinhibition-bisbas-scales

bisbas_bas-fun-seeking.Description: BIS/BAS (24-Item) Behavioral Activation/Inhibition (BIS/BAS) scales - BAS Fun Seeking. http://www.midss.org/content/behavioral-avoidanceinhibition-bisbas-scales

bisbas_bas-reward-respons.Description: BIS/BAS (24-Item) Behavioral Activation/Inhibition (BIS/BAS) scales - BAS Reward Responsiveness. http://www.midss.org/content/behavioral-avoidanceinhibition-bisbas-scales

tpq-ns_exploratory_excit.Description: Tridimensional Personality Questionnaire Novelty-Seeking - Exploratory Excitability.

sss_tas.Description: Zuckerman Sensation-Seeking Scale (SSS-V 40-item) - TAS (Thrill and Adventure Seeking). https://scienceofbehaviorchange.org/measures/zuckerman-sensation-seeking-scale-v/

flanker_diff-rt-incong-cong.Description: Flanker Task - Reaction time difference (Incongruent minus Congruent)

flanker_numwrong-cong.Description: Flanker Task - Number of incorrect responses (Congruent)

flanker_numwrong-incong.Description: Flanker Task - Number of incorrect responses (Incongruent)

cpt-ii_adhd-index.Description: Conners' Continuous Performance Test II (CPT II) - ADHD Confidence Index Assessment

cpt-ii_omissions.Description: Conners' Continuous Performance Test II (CPT II) - Omissions T-score (Omissions result from the failure to respond to target letters (i.e., non-Xs))

cpt-ii_commissions.Description: Conners' Continuous Performance Test II (CPT II) - Comissions T-score (Commission errors are made when responses are given to non-targets (i.e., Xs))

cpt-ii_hit-rt.Description: Conners' Continuous Performance Test II (CPT II) - Hit Reaction Time T-score (Overall Hit Reaction Time is the average speed of correct responses for the entire test)

cpt-ii_hit-se.Description: Conners' Continuous Performance Test II (CPT II) - Hit Standard Error T-score (Standard Error is a measure of response speed consistency. The higher the Overall Standard Error, the greater the inconsistency in the response speed)

cpt-ii_variability.Description: Conners' Continuous Performance Test II (CPT II) - Hit Reaction Time Variability T-score (Like Overall Standard Error, the Variability of Standard Error is a measure of response speed consistency. However, Variability of Standard Error measures 'within respondent' variability. That is, the amount of variability the individual shows in 18 separate segments of the test in relation to his or her own overall standard error. Although Variability of Standard Error is a different measure than Overall Standard Error, typically the two measures produce comparable results. The higher the Variability of Standard Error, the greater the inconsistency in the response speed)

cpt-ii_detectability.Description: Conners' Continuous Performance Test II (CPT II) - Detectability (D-prime) T-score (The value d' is a measure of the difference between the signal (non-X) and noise (X) distributions. As such d' provides a means for assessing an individual's discriminative power since, in general, the greater the difference between the signal and noise distributions, the better the ability to distinguish and detect X and non-X stimuli)

cpt-ii_response-style.Description: Conners' Continuous Performance Test II (CPT II) - Response Style (Beta) T-score (Beta represents an individual's response tendency: Some individuals are cautious and choose not to respond very often. Conceptually, such individuals want to make sure they are correct when they give a response. Higher values of Beta reflect this response style. The emphasis is on avoiding commission errors. Other individuals respond more freely to make sure they respond to most or all targets, and they tend to be less concerned about mistakenly responding to a non-target. Lower values of Beta are produced by this response style)

cpt-ii_perseverations.Description: Conners' Continuous Performance Test II (CPT II) - Perseverations T-score (Any reaction time that is less than 100 ms constitutes a perseverative response. Given normal expectations of physiological ability to respond, such responses are usually either slow responses to a preceding stimuli, a random response, an anticipatory response, or a response repeated without consideration of the stimuli or task requirements)

cpt-ii_hit-rt-block-change.Description: Conners' Continuous Performance Test II (CPT II) - Hit Reaction Time Block Change T-score (Hit RT Block Change measures change in reaction time across the duration of the test. High values of Hit RT Block Change indicate a substantial slowing in reaction times. Low values indicate that responses got quicker as the test progressed)

cpt-ii_hit-se-block-change.Description: Conners' Continuous Performance Test II (CPT II) - Hit Standard Error Block Change T-score (Standard Error by Block detects changes in response consistency over the duration of the test. High values of Hit SE Block Change indicate a substantial loss of consistency as the test progressed. Low values on this measure indicate sustained or improved response consistency)

cpt-ii_hit-rt-isi-change.Description: Conners' Continuous Performance Test II (CPT II) - Hit Reaction Time Inter-stimulus Interval Change T-score (This measure examines change in average reaction times at the different Inter-Stimulus Intervals (i.e. when the letters are presented at 1, 2, or 4 sec. intervals))

cpt-ii_hit-se-isi-change.Description: Conners' Continuous Performance Test II (CPT II) - Hit Reaction Time Standard Error Inter-stimulus Interval Change T-score (This measure examines change in the standard error of reaction times at the different Inter-Stimulus Intervals (i.e., when the letters are presented at 1, 2, or 4 sec. intervals))

tova_rt-var-first-half.Description: Test of Variables of Attention (TOVA) - Reaction Time variability (First Half) - (Measure of inattention/sustained attention (quantity)) - Standard Score

tova_rt-var-second-half.Description: Test of Variables of Attention (TOVA) - Reaction Time variability (Second Half) - (Measure of inattention/sustained attention (quantity)) - Standard Score

tova_rt-var-total.Description: Test of Variables of Attention (TOVA) - Reaction Time variability (Total) - (Measure of inattention/sustained attention (quantity)) - Standard Score

tova_rt-first-half.Description: Test of Variables of Attention (TOVA) - Reaction Time (First Half) - Standard Score

tova_rt-second-half.Description: Test of Variables of Attention (TOVA) - Reaction Time (Second Half) - Standard Score

tova_rt-total.Description: Test of Variables of Attention (TOVA) - Reaction Time (Total) - Standard Score

tova_dprime-first-half.Description: Test of Variables of Attention (TOVA) - DPrime (First Half) - (Measure of distractibility) - Standard Score

tova_dprime-second-half.Description: Test of Variables of Attention (TOVA) - DPrime (Second Half) - (Measure of distractibility) - Standard Score

tova_dprime-total.Description: Test of Variables of Attention (TOVA) - DPrime (Total) - (Measure of distractibility) - Standard Score

tova_commission-err-first-half.Description: Test of Variables of Attention (TOVA) - Commission Errors (First Half) - (Measure of impulsivity) - Standard Score

tova_commission-err-second-half.Description: Test of Variables of Attention (TOVA) - Commission Errors (Second Half) - (Measure of impulsivity) - Standard Score

tova_commission-err-total.Description: Test of Variables of Attention (TOVA) - Commission Errors (Total) - (Measure of impulsivity) - Standard Score

tova_omission-err-first-half.Description: Test of Variables of Attention (TOVA) - Ommission Errors (First Half) - (Measure of inattention/focused attention) - Standard Score

tova_omission-err-second-half.Description: Test of Variables of Attention (TOVA) - Ommission Errors (Second Half) - (Measure of inattention/focused attention) - Standard Score

tova_omission-err-total.Description: Test of Variables of Attention (TOVA) - Ommission Errors (Total) - (Measure of inattention/focused attention) - Standard Score

tova_adhd-score.Description: Test of Variables of Attention (TOVA) - ADHD Score (The ADHD score is a comparison of the subject's response to those of an ADHD group. An ADHD score of -1.80 or less (more negative) fits the profile of the ADHD sample. A score of more than -1.80 (more positive) does not fit the ADHD profile. When comparing ADHD scores (such as with medication challenges), the higher the ADHD score the better the performance. Thus, the ADHD score can be used as an indicator of response to treatment)

panas-actual_hap.Description: PANAS Actual - High Arousal Positive (Affect Valuation Index: https://culture-emotion-lab.stanford.edu/projects/toolsmaterials/affect-valuation-index)

panas-actual_lap.Description: PANAS Actual - Low Arousal Positive (Affect Valuation Index: https://culture-emotion-lab.stanford.edu/projects/toolsmaterials/affect-valuation-index)

panas-actual_ha.Description: PANAS Actual - High Arousal (Affect Valuation Index: https://culture-emotion-lab.stanford.edu/projects/toolsmaterials/affect-valuation-index)

panas-ideal_lan.Description: PANAS Ideal - Low Arousal Negative (Affect Valuation Index: https://culture-emotion-lab.stanford.edu/projects/toolsmaterials/affect-valuation-index)
